text:
I apologize if this is reported in the wrong location; I could not find a
product associated with just the Tomcat Connector product (mod_jk).

I am using mod_jk 1.2.21 on Solaris 8 with Apache 2.0.59. During regular
maintenance I noticed that our mod_jk.log had grown far larger than expected.
It is filled with lines like the following:

[Tue Apr 17 09:26:19 2007] worker server.wisc.edu 0.008697
[Tue Apr 17 09:26:21 2007] worker server.wisc.edu 0.014478
[Tue Apr 17 09:26:21 2007] worker server.wisc.edu 0.004808
[Tue Apr 17 09:26:21 2007] worker server.wisc.edu 0.008812
[Tue Apr 17 09:26:21 2007] worker server.wisc.edu 0.009066

I thought that these lines were only output at the "info" JkLogLevel, however
the server is currently configured at the "error" JkLogLevel.

Here is my relevant connector configuration in apache:
LoadModule jk_module modules/mod_jk.so
JkWorkersFile /path/to/httpd/conf/workers.properties
JkLogFile /path/to/httpd/logs/mod_jk.log
JkLogLevel error
JkLogStampFormat "[%a %b %d %H:%M:%S %Y] "
JkRequestLogFormat "%w %V %T"

workers.properties looks like:
worker.list=worker
worker.worker.type=ajp13
worker.worker.host=127.0.0.1
worker.worker.port=8009

Is it possible these log statements are incorrectly being made at the error
level, or is this desired behavior?
creator: nblair@doit.wisc.edu

text:
perhaps this should not be a Bug, now that I've looked a bit further in the code
(my C knowledge is a bit rusty). It appears that these messages are logged at
the level JK_LOG_REQUEST_LEVEL, which is higher than all other levels (including
emerg). 

Is it possible to make a feature request to disable request logging? I'd rather
leave it off on high traffic production servers.
creator: nblair@doit.wisc.edu

text:
I found what I was looking for, on
http://tomcat.apache.org/connectors-doc/reference/apache.html:

JkRequestLogFormat
Request log format string. See detailed description below.
There is no default value. Without defining a value, the request logging is
turned off.
creator: nblair@doit.wisc.edu
